title: Theodore Roosevelt Birthplace National Historic Site: Accessibility
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Accessibility             Accessibility         Theodore Roosevelt Birthplace NPS  There is limited handicap access to Theodore Roosevelt Birthplace National Historic Site. In order to access the site, visitors must descend 6 steps to enter the house. Due to the historic nature of the home, there is no handrail on the entrance stairway. Wheelchairs (both motorized and non-motorized) are not allowed inside the house. To access the main floor gallery, visitors must descend 3 steps. The five period rooms and second floor gallery are accessible by elevator. To access the auditorium (for special events), visitors may take the elevator to the third floor, then must ascend 19 steps to enter the auditorium. For further questions regarding accessibility, please call 212-260-1616 and speak to a staff member.
